metadata.title: CVE-2022-1050 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the QEMU implementation of VMWare's paravirtual RDMAdevice. This flaw allows a crafted guest driver to execute HW commands whenshared buffers are not yet allocated, potentially leading to ause-after-free condition.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
